hackathon-description-text: The 24 hour Diversity Hackathon is sponsored by an interdisciplinary partnership between the College of Architecture Diversity Council; College of Engineering; College of Architecture ITS; University Libraries; Center on Disability & Development; Disability Services; GLBT Resource Center; and League of United Latin American Citizens, TAMU Chapter and is open to all TAMU faculty, staff and students.
hackathon-eligibility:
Texas A&M students, faculty and staff from all backgrounds and disciplines are welcome. Although not required, it is encouraged to join a team.
.
This event is part of an IRB approved study to test the Hackathon format as a new method for engaging students in the topic of Diversity in higher education institutions. IRB NUMBER: IRB2016-0061D; IRB APPROVAL DATE: 01/17/2018; IRB EXPIRATION DATE: 12/14/2018
To participate in the event, you will be asked to sign the following consent form, you may review it in advance [excerpt, full version will be provided during on-site registration]:
hackathon-requirements:
by 12pm on Saturday 3rd Feb. We will circulate the sign up at 10am on Saturday via an update / email. 
Submit Project through Devpost: Watch the 'Option 1' 
: Start submitting your project early by entering what info you can on the submission form, and then save it as a draft. That way you won't be rushed toward the end. You'll be able to keep updating it until the deadline 
Save your presentation to a USB and bring it to Geren Auditorium to load onto the computer that will be used for Show & Tell Presentations no later than 2pm.
 in Geren Auditorium, Langford building B. (Not all team members need to be present during the Show&Tell)
Please note that projects will be judged on the basis of the material presented during Show & Tell.
hackathon-rules:
Please note there are no showers on site. 
We will provide plenty food, snacks and beverages. We do encourage you to bring your water bottle and utilize our Water Refill stations. 
 Organizers researve the right to change Awards, Prizes and amounts.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Challenge #1: Zachry Engineering Education Complex: Best Project
Challenge #3: GLBT Resource Center: Best Project
Challenge #4: Texas A&M Collegiate LULAC: Best Project
Challenge #6: College of Architecture Diversity Council: Best Project
Surprise Prize TBD on the day

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Langford Architecture Bldg, College Station, TX 77840, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Barriers erased! Great response to the brief, more than the Challengers could imagine.
Great looking/sounding, great fit, great solution
The project has a potential to impact many people.

hackathon-location-address: Langford Architecture Bldg, College Station, TX 77840, USA
hackathon-description-header: The event is a 24 hour competition during which participants will creatively respond to Challenges presented by TAMU units , which pertain to the topic of Space & Place of Texas A&M campus.
